results.title: The Adventures of Milo and Otis
results.creator_credit: Masanori Hata, Satoru Ogata, Masaru Kakutani, Columbia Pictures and Fuji Television Network
results.brief_description: Join a curious kitten named Milo and his inseparable buddy, a pug-nosed pup named Otis, as they fall, frolic, glide and tumble through one exciting escapade after another. Raised together on a friendly, sunny farm, Milo and Otis love to explore the countryside and tease the barnyard animals. But one day mischievous little Milo lets curiosity get the better of him and he’s suddenly swept down a rushing river in a wooden box. Taking off to rescue his best friend, Otis also leaves the safety of the farm behind him forever. What starts as an amusing and funny game soon turns into the most breathtaking, heartwrenching adventure of their lives … where love and friendship are the most wonderful gifts of all. Based on an original story by Masanori Hata. Narrated by Dudley Moore.

results.title: The Adventures of Mary-Kate & Ashley
results.brief_description: Mystery, action and songs abound as Detectives Mary-Kate and Ashley undertake a set of daring advetures. These trenchcoat twins and their dog Clue live by their agency motto to “solve any crime by dinner time.”

results.title: The Adventures of Marco Polo
results.creator_credit: Samuel Goldwyn, Samuel Goldwyn Productions and Archie Mayo
results.brief_description: Gary Cooper stars as 13th Century explorer and adventurer Marco Polo, the Venetian who opened the trade route from Europe to China. At the court of the great Kublai Khan, ruler of the Mongol Empire, Marco battles the intrigue of the court to win the admiration of the great Khan and the love of a beautiful Princess (Sigrid Guthrie). A classic historical drama filled with spectacular battle scenes, panoramas, opulent sets and costumes. Co-starring Basil Rathbone.

results.title: The Adventures of Huck Finn
results.creator_credit: Laurence Mark, Walt Disney Pictures and Stephen Sommers
results.brief_description: Film adaptation of the classic 19th century novel ‘The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn’ by American writer, Mark Twain. This is a story about Huck Finn (Elijah Wood), a poor uneducated boy who has run away from home to escape his abusive drunken father, and Huck’s chance encounter with Jim (Courtney S. Vance), an escaped slave. Together the two follow the Mississippi River finding adventure and drama and some rather dubious characters by the names of the King (Jason Robards) and the Duke (Robbie Coltrane). Cast also includes Ron Perlman and Laura Bundy.

results.title: The Adventures of Handyman
results.creator_credit: Craig Salvin, AFTRS and Martin Murphy
results.brief_description: A suburban damsel in distress with a blocked sink heralds the arrival of Handyman - mild mannered and silver haired Reg O’Grady who proves that super heroes don’t have a shelf life.

results.title: The Adventures of Buzz Boy & Buzz Girl
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
This animated short depicts the adventures between an evil bee and super hero insects. Dr. Bee has hypnotised Buzz Boy to steal for him, after poisoning a peanut and jelly sandwich. Buzz Girl finds out the truth and informs Buzz Boy. Together they set out in search of Dr.Bee. They find him and are caught up in a high speed chase which eventuates in Dr.Bee crashing into the side of a skyscraper.

results.title: The Adventures of Blinky Bill: Mayor Blinky Bill
results.creator_credit: Yoram Gross Films and Yoram Gross
results.brief_description: This animated tale features Blinky Bill and his friends. The episode, titled “Mayor Blinky Bill” sees Blinky Bill become Mayor. Being popular among the locals Blinky speaks up at a Council meeting where the loss of water from fire trucks is discussed. It seems that bumpy roads are the cause. Blinky takes on the job with enthusiasm until things become a little complicated. Blinky then finds himself facing annoying red tape and bureaucracy in trying to improve things. Blinky rethinks his position and reaches for the faithful fishing rod in exchange for the responsibility of the Mayor handing back the hat and all the difficulty that goes with it.

results.title: The Adventures of Blinky Bill
results.creator_credit: Yoram Gross and Yoram Gross Films
results.brief_description: Blinky Bill is one of the most loved characters in Australian children’s literature. He and his friends get up to many adventures in the bush in this popular animated series.

results.title: The Adventures of Barry McKenzie
results.creator_credit: Phillip Adams, Bruce Beresford and Longford
results.brief_description: Barry Crocker plays Barry McKenzie, a wild colonial who heads off for London with a legacy left to him by an uncle. He makes straight for Earls Court to join up with his mates, and from there rampages through London with his Aunt Edna (Barry Humphries), “cracking tubes”, “chundering”, and “pointing Percy in the snake’s room” all the way. His adventures culminate in an interview, (minus his trousers), with Joan Blakewell and the BBC. Dennis Price, in one of the last films he made before he died, with Spike Milligan and Peter Cook add their comic talents to this ‘adventurous’ movie.

results.title: The Adventures of Baron Munchausen
results.creator_credit: Thomas Schuhly, Columbia Pictures, Prominent Features, Laura Film and Terry Gilliam
results.brief_description: Baron Munchausen is a seventeen-century aristocrat with a taste for adventure and a tendency to embellish his past. The aging Baron decides to come to the rescue of a British town under siege from Turkish marauders. With this feature film Terry Gilliam (The Fisher King, Twelve monkeys, Brazil, Time bandits, Fear and loathing in Las Vegas) continues his penchant for elaborate costume drama/comedy involving expensive productions, extensive casting and complex detailed settings. The story follows Munchausen on a series of daring adventures including: ballooning to the moon, being swallowed by a whale, exploring the inside of a volcano, cheating the executioner’s axe and a date with Botticelli’s Venus. Travelling with Munchausen are the fastest man in the world, the man with the best hearing, the strongest man, a man with breath as strong as the wind and one girl who is the only person to thoroughly believe in him. Resplendent set pieces evoke memories of (and at times appears to reference) the more financially successful “Time bandits”. Cast and cameos include: John Neville, Uma Thurman, Eric Idle, Sarah Polley, Jack Purvis, Charles McKeowan, Robin Williams.
